text: Liom duɔ̱ɔ̱rä la ji̱i̱n mi̱ dɔ̱ŋ ɛ no̱o̱ŋɛ, kä mi̱ caa jicdɛ liny laa bëë raar kä tuŋ in göl in caa nyoth.
translated_text: Nuer: Turki̱ caa go̱l ɛ bar geeknikɛ da̱ŋdiɔ̱k: jɛn Bar Aegean kui̱c caam,kɛ jɛn Bar Blak nhiam kɛnɛ jɛn Bar Mɛdi̱tɛrɛnian jɔɔkdɛ. English: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. Nuer: Ni kɛ tuk köör laa jälkɛ kɛ wi̱c pi̱i̱ni̱ bäpdiit, duundɛ ɣöö kɛ gua̱th ee caa rɛdaar ben tok kɛ lätni̱ kä cɛ ben raŋ cuɛ tha̱bmari̱i̱ni̱ jak kä ɣöö bikɛ ja̱l kɛ piny pi̱i̱ni̱ kɛ ɣöö /caa kɛ bi̱ kulɛ nɛn. English: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. Nuer: Liom duɔ̱ɔ̱rä la ji̱i̱n mi̱ dɔ̱ŋ ɛ no̱o̱ŋɛ, kä mi̱ caa jicdɛ liny laa bëë raar kä tuŋ in göl in caa nyoth. English: The ships are not only used for transport, but also for military purposes. English: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. Nuer: Deri ja̱l kɛ boda-boda (thurbil jäthä muɔntɔrä) kɛ wädu kä Goma. Yio̱w tin la kɔatkɛ jɛ (rɛy wec) kɛ ~500 Kɔŋ-gɔli̱th 'Francs' mi wi̱i̱ gua̱a̱th mi thia̱k. text: Kɛ kui̱c nɛɛni̱ tin jɛk gɔɔy lätni̱ raar, wä ja̱l kam Baar kɛnɛ wec.
translated_text: Nuer: Turki̱ caa go̱l ɛ bar geeknikɛ da̱ŋdiɔ̱k: jɛn Bar Aegean kui̱c caam,kɛ jɛn Bar Blak nhiam kɛnɛ jɛn Bar Mɛdi̱tɛrɛnian jɔɔkdɛ. English: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. Nuer: Ni kɛ tuk köör laa jälkɛ kɛ wi̱c pi̱i̱ni̱ bäpdiit, duundɛ ɣöö kɛ gua̱th ee caa rɛdaar ben tok kɛ lätni̱ kä cɛ ben raŋ cuɛ tha̱bmari̱i̱ni̱ jak kä ɣöö bikɛ ja̱l kɛ piny pi̱i̱ni̱ kɛ ɣöö /caa kɛ bi̱ kulɛ nɛn. English: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. Nuer: Kɛ kui̱c nɛɛni̱ tin jɛk gɔɔy lätni̱ raar, wä ja̱l kam Baar kɛnɛ wec. English: The ships were not as fast as the submarines, but they were more maneuverable. Nuer: Kɛ kui̱c nɛɛni̱ tin jɛk gɔɔy lätni̱ raar, wä ja̱l kam Baar kɛnɛ wec.

text: A ja̱l thapa̱ri̱ ( min cɔalkɛ bä i̱ " Ja̱l dɔaar", "ɣaikiŋ thapa̱ri̱", kiɛ wä "Ja̱l kɛ ciök") laa tekɛ ɣaikiŋ, cäŋ kɛɛ thaakni̱ ti̱ tɔt kiɛ ni̱n ti̱ ŋuan.
translated_text: Nuer: Turki̱ caa go̱l ɛ bar geeknikɛ da̱ŋdiɔ̱k: jɛn Bar Aegean kui̱c caam,kɛ jɛn Bar Blak nhiam kɛnɛ jɛn Bar Mɛdi̱tɛrɛnian jɔɔkdɛ. English: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. Nuer: Ni kɛ tuk köör laa jälkɛ kɛ wi̱c pi̱i̱ni̱ bäpdiit, duundɛ ɣöö kɛ gua̱th ee caa rɛdaar ben tok kɛ lätni̱ kä cɛ ben raŋ cuɛ tha̱bmari̱i̱ni̱ jak kä ɣöö bikɛ ja̱l kɛ piny pi̱i̱ni̱ kɛ ɣöö /caa kɛ bi̱ kulɛ nɛn. English: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. Nuer: A ja̱l thapa̱ri̱ ( min cɔalkɛ bä i̱ " Ja̱l dɔaar", "ɣaikiŋ thapa̱ri̱", kiɛ wä "Ja̱l kɛ ciök") laa tekɛ ɣaikiŋ, cäŋ kɛɛ thaakni̱ ti̱ tɔt kiɛ ni̱n ti̱ ŋuan. English: The Ja̱l thapa̱ri̱ was a type of submarine that was used in the war. Nuer: A ja̱l thapa̱ri̱ laa tekɛ ɣaikiŋ, cäŋ kɛɛ thaakni̱ ti̱ tɔt kiɛ ni̱n ti̱ ŋuan.

text: Mi ca thuɔ̱rbiɛli ti̱ ŋuan kɔak piny bä dee rik ja̱l tuɔɔk ce̱tkɛ ɣöö dee kɛn röm rɛy duɔ̱p, nɔmɔ no̱o̱ŋɛ duɔ̱ɔ̱p mi dɔ̱ŋ min la̱t kɛ pua̱ny nath kɛ jɛ duel wa̱l.
translated_text: Nuer: Turki̱ caa go̱l ɛ bar geeknikɛ da̱ŋdiɔ̱k: jɛn Bar Aegean kui̱c caam,kɛ jɛn Bar Blak nhiam kɛnɛ jɛn Bar Mɛdi̱tɛrɛnian jɔɔkdɛ. English: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. Nuer: Ni kɛ tuk köör laa jälkɛ kɛ wi̱c pi̱i̱ni̱ bäpdiit, duundɛ ɣöö kɛ gua̱th ee caa rɛdaar ben tok kɛ lätni̱ kä cɛ ben raŋ cuɛ tha̱bmari̱i̱ni̱ jak kä ɣöö bikɛ ja̱l kɛ piny pi̱i̱ni̱ kɛ ɣöö /caa kɛ bi̱ kulɛ nɛn. English: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. Nuer: Mi ca thuɔ̱rbiɛli ti̱ ŋuan kɔak piny bä dee rik ja̱l tuɔɔk ce̱tkɛ ɣöö dee kɛn röm rɛy duɔ̱p, nɔmɔ no̱o̱ŋɛ duɔ̱ɔ̱p mi dɔ̱ŋ min la̱t kɛ pua̱ny nath kɛ jɛ duel wa̱l. English: The submarines were not the only ones to be used in the war. The ships of the Turkish navy were also used, and the Turkish navy was the most powerful navy in the world at the time. Nuer: Mi duɔ̱ɔ̱p mi dɔ̱ŋ min la̱t kɛ pua̱ny nath kɛ jɛ duel wa̱l.

text: Nɛy tin Bo̱o̱th kä ri̱tha̱c laarkɛn ɛ i̱ nɛmɛ no̱o̱ŋɛ ɣöö dee juëy mi̱ cetkɛ ka̱n-tha, Tak, Kɔɔr kɛnɛ maleria mal nɛn kä ji̱ jua̱thni tin te wi̱i̱ni̱ tin can, gua̱a̱th in näk ka̱n-tha naath thin ɛlɔ̱ŋ min dëë laa nuth kä wi̱i̱c tin ruäŋ.

text: Kɛn gaat ti̱ti̱ la kɛn rɔ̱ laa jiäk rɛy rikni̱ ti̱ ŋuan, kɛ ɣöö la kɛn "laa lät rɛy lätni̱ ti̱ bɛ̈cbɛ̈ɛ̈c ti̱ riɛk nööŋ, bi̱ kɛ rɔ̱ jiäk rɛy ko̱o̱ri̱, kä bi̱ kɛ nɛy ti̱ tä kɛ ŋuɔ̱t gak" ɛ jɛn bi̱ wicdiɛn ku lɛ lät a gɔaaɔ, kɛ ɣöö /ci̱ wicdiɛn lät a gɔaa kɛ tin la̱tkɛ ɛ nɛy ti̱ loy wicdiɛn.

text: Ɛn duel wa̱l cɛ ŋuɔ̱t guɔ̱ɔ̱r kɛ kui̱ jua̱th in dee naath käp, ce̱tkɛ dääk nɛɛni tin tekɛ juey kɛnɛ nɛy tin thiɛl juey kɛ ɣöö dëë nɛy tin kɔ̱ŋ gaŋ kɛ ɣöö /ci juey kɛ bi käp.
translated_text: Nuer: Turki̱ caa go̱l ɛ bar geeknikɛ da̱ŋdiɔ̱k: jɛn Bar Aegean kui̱c caam,kɛ jɛn Bar Blak nhiam kɛnɛ jɛn Bar Mɛdi̱tɛrɛnian jɔɔkdɛ. English: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. Nuer: Ɛn duel wa̱l cɛ ŋuɔ̱t guɔ̱ɔ̱r kɛ kui̱ jua̱th in dee naath käp, ce̱tkɛ dääk nɛɛni tin tekɛ juey kɛnɛ nɛy tin thiɛl juey kɛ ɣöö dëë nɛy tin kɔ̱ŋ gaŋ kɛ ɣöö /ci juey kɛ bi käp. English: The first submarine was a German-built U-Boat, which was launched in the year 1943. Nuer: Ɛn dääk nɛɛni tin tekɛ juey kɛnɛ nɛy tin thiɛl juey kɛ ɣöö dëë nɛy tin kɔ̱ŋ gaŋ kɛ ɣöö /ci juey kɛ bi käp. Nuer: Ɛn dääk nɛɛni tin tekɛ juey kɛnɛ nɛy tin thiɛl juey

text: Ni tukädɛ, muaŋ pi̱i̱ni Gonu,  mi cɔalkɛ ciötdɛ kɛ kui̱ dɛɛni jiaath kɛ thok ji̱ Maldives, cɛ jɔam tin görkɛ cop kɛ pek kilömiti̱ri̱ ti 240 kɛ thaak kɛl (149 kɛ thaak ɛ na̱n).

English: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. Nuer: Ni kɛ tuk köör laa jälkɛ kɛ wi̱c pi̱i̱ni̱ bäpdiit, duundɛ ɣöö kɛ gua̱th ee caa rɛdaar ben tok kɛ lätni̱ kä cɛ ben raŋ cuɛ tha̱bmari̱i̱ni̱ jak kä ɣöö bikɛ ja̱l kɛ piny pi̱i̱ni̱ kɛ ɣöö /caa kɛ bi̱ kulɛ nɛn. English: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. Nuer: Ni tukädɛ, muaŋ pi̱i̱ni Gonu, mi cɔalkɛ ciötdɛ kɛ kui̱ dɛɛni jiaath kɛ thok ji̱ Maldives, cɛ jɔam tin görkɛ cop kɛ pek kilömiti̱ri̱ ti 240 kɛ thaak kɛl (149 kɛ thaak ɛ na̱n). English: The first submarine to be used in the war was the German U-Boat U-505, which was launched in May 1942.
